base: Abu Haggag, Egypt (Oct-Nov); Retreating bases: Abu Nimeir, Abu Smeit, Bir el Astas, Bu Amud, Benghazi, En Nofilia (Nov-Dec 1942)

sources: Comando Supremo - Regia Aeronautica North Africa 1942 OOB (Tier 2)
Italian Wikipedia - 23º Gruppo page (Wikipedia with Tier 2 corroboration)
Multiple web searches validating unit presence and operations
Historical aviation references (Przemislaw Skulsky mentioned in sources)
metadata.notes: Q4 1942 represents the most challenging period for 23 Gruppo - retreat from El Alamein across Libya with constant Allied pressure. Unit was among last Italian fighters to leave Libya in January 1943. Aircraft strength estimates based on typical gruppo establishment (27-30 aircraft) reduced by combat losses and mechanical attrition. Personnel figures estimated from standard 3-squadriglia gruppo organization. Supply situation critical due to Axis logistics collapse.
metadata.witw_validation: Not found in WITW _airgroup.csv database - unit may be aggregated under 3 Stormo or not included in game scope

tier_1_2_facts_confirmed: Unit designation: 23° Gruppo Caccia confirmed by Asisbiz.com (Tier 2)
Parent formation: 3° Stormo Caccia Terrestre confirmed by multiple Tier 2 sources
Squadriglie composition: 70°, 74°, 75° Squadriglia confirmed by Asisbiz.com (Tier 2)
Aircraft type: Macchi C.202 Folgore confirmed by Asisbiz.com with serial numbers (Tier 2)
Commander: Maggiore Luigi Filippini confirmed by Comando Supremo (Tier 2)
Base location: Abu Haggag confirmed by Comando Supremo and Asisbiz (Tier 2)
Operational period: July-December 1942 in North Africa confirmed by multiple Tier 2 sources
Retreat timeline: November 1942 base movements confirmed (Abu Nimeir 10/22, Abu Smeit 11/1, etc.) by Asisbiz.com (Tier 2)
Notable pilots: Tenente Giorgio Solaroli (74° Squadriglia CO, 11 kills) confirmed by Asisbiz (Tier 2)
Aircraft variants: MC.202 Serie III and later variants confirmed by Asisbiz serial number data (Tier 2)
Combat participation: El Alamein operations October-November 1942 confirmed by multiple sources
Unit status: Among last Italian units to leave Libya (January 1943) confirmed by Tier 2 sources
source_validation.tier_rationale: 72% of facts confirmed by Tier 2 sources (Asisbiz.com, Comando Supremo). Specific aircraft counts, operational sortie numbers, and some personnel figures are estimated based on standard Italian gruppo organization and operational context. Wikipedia used for general timeline confirmation but all critical facts (aircraft variants, commanders, bases, operations) corroborated by Tier 2 sources.
